conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls extruded with thickness, multi-face surfaces visible, angled/isometric perspective, and ceiling/roof removed to reveal interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable wall thickness and corners; clear floor-vs-wall separation and interior volume. Cutaway is clean with only minor simplification at a few edges/openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency match well (central living/dining, top deck, bedrooms on left/top/right, kitchen/utility/toilets at lower/right). Minor proportional drift and a few partition/opening placements appear slightly simplified versus the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (beds, living seating, dining table), kitchen counters/island represented, and bathroom fixtures included. Some elements are simplified and not all built-ins precisely match the 2D symboling.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with distinct walls/floors and adequate lighting. Minor presentation/UI artifacts (navigation arrow) and some areas are slightly occluded by perspective.

detected_errors.description: Small proportional/layout simplifications: a few internal partition lengths and room proportions (notably around kitchen/utility/toilet cluster) appear slightly adjusted compared to the 2D plan.
Some door/window/opening details are simplified in 3D (not all swing/placement cues are as explicit as the 2D drawing), though overall opening locations largely align.
A navigation/marker arrow is visible in the 3D render background.

summary: A clear and correct cutaway 3D conversion with strong layout fidelity overall, with only minor proportional and opening-detail simplifications versus the 2D plan.
